intro: Casearia latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Casearia latifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
